page.title: 05FARMING AROUND COSHESTON
page.content: Most of our block is farming land. There are over ten farms. Nearly all the farms keep cattle for beef. Only two of the farms have dairy herds. Some of the farms keep sheep but beef cattle are the most popular livestock in the area. There are very few pigs. One farm, at Winter Hall, keeps poultry. At this farm, there are 3O,OOO chickens laying eggs. Most farmers grow corn. Barley is the most popular crop with some oats grown. None of the farmers grow wheat. Because of its mild climate, Pembrokeshire is famous for its early potatoes and some of the farmers in the area grow them. Pembrokeshire potatoes are sent to all parts of Britain. Although all the farms use modern equipment and tractors, the farmers still have to be up very early to look after the animals.
